body: Mikey is not dead. The news came after the backslapping, after the meatballs, after the cigarettes had burned a while, and long after the neighborhood was lost. ''They told me Mikey died,'' said Bullets, a big man. His voice was wrecked. ''No,'' Johnny Apples said. ''It was Ralphie that died. Ralphie died, not Mikey. In the house, all by himself.''
